threads.subject: It looks like you need more tokens
threads.preview: Youâ€™re maxing out. Dev Tier gives you more Hi there, Looks like your project is reaching some seriou
threads.summary: Groq's developer tier is being recommended due to the project reaching its token limit, offering higher token limits, premium chat support, and other features to avoid rate limits and downtime. The developer tier is self-serve and has no monthly commitments, allowing for easy switching back if needed.

gmail:Groq <developer@groq.co>.summary: The Groq team has shared some helpful resources to support our project, including a newsletter and community forums. They've also recommended upgrading to the developer tier due to our token limit being reached, which would give us higher limits and premium support. This tier is self-serve and flexible, so we can switch back if needed. No meetings are set, but it's worth exploring these options to avoid rate limits and downtime. We can review the resources and consider the upgrade at our convenience.

threads.subject: Follow-Up: Equipment Issue in Chemistry Lab
threads.preview: *Dear Dr. Usman,* Thank you for your prompt response regarding the spectrometer issue. To provide fu
threads.summary: Dawood Saleem, a research assistant in the Chemistry Department, is experiencing issues with the spectrometer in the lab, which is producing inconsistent readings and making unusual noises. He's seeking guidance from Dr. Usman on the cause of the problem, which occurred on December 3, 2025. Dawood is willing to provide additional information to help resolve the issue and ensure the lab equipment functions reliably.
threads.last_subject: Follow-Up: Equipment Issue in Chemistry Lab
threads.last_body: *Dear Dr. Usman,* Thank you for your prompt response regarding the spectrometer issue. To provide further details, on *December 3, 2025*, while attempting calibration, I observed that the spectrometerâ€™s readings were inconsistent and fluctuated despite following the standard procedure. I also noticed a slight unusual noise from the device during operation. This seems to have affected the measurements of the experiments conducted on that day. Could you please advise why this issue may have occurred? I want to ensure that such problems can be prevented in the future and that the lab equipment functions reliably for ongoing experiments. I am happy to provide additional observations or assist the technical team in any way required. Thank you again for your guidance. Best regards, *Dawood Saleem* Research Assistant, Chemistry Department

threads.subject: Reporting Equipment Issue in Chemistry Lab
threads.preview: *Dear Dr. Usman,* I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to report an issue observed in th
threads.summary: Javaria Saleem reported a spectrometer issue in the Chemistry Lab to Dr. Usman, which affected ongoing experiments. The technical team will inspect and perform maintenance on December 4, 2025. Javaria has been asked to pause critical experiments and document observations for the team's reference. Dr. Usman will oversee the resolution and arrange for special accommodations if needed.
threads.last_subject: Re: Reporting Equipment Issue in Chemistry Lab
threads.last_body: *Dear Dr. Usman,* I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to report an issue observed in the spectrometer in the Chemistry Lab. On *December 3, 2025*, I noticed that the spectrometer was not calibrating properly, which affected the accuracy of ongoing measurements. This has impacted several experiments scheduled for this week. I kindly request your guidance on the next steps to resolve this issue. If required, I am available to provide further details or assist with troubleshooting at your convenience. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your advice. Best regards, *Dawood Saleem* Research Assistant, Chemistry Department >

gmail:Javaria Saleem <javariasaleem39@gm.summary: There's an issue with the spectrometer in the Chemistry Lab that's causing inconsistent readings and noises, which was reported by Dawood and Javaria Saleem. Dr. Usman is overseeing the resolution and the technical team is set to inspect and perform maintenance on December 4. Experiments have been paused and Javaria is documenting observations to aid in the repair.

threads.subject: Using Cursor's Agent
threads.preview: Cursor Cursor Agent ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/overview ) can take on complex coding tasks, suc
threads.summary: The Cursor Team shared tips on using their Agent tool, which can handle complex coding tasks, and provided documentation links for features like context symbols, checkpoints, and command execution. The team outlined how to get the most out of Agent, including using "@" for specific context and defining rules for system-level instructions. No meeting is scheduled, but the information is available for reference on the Cursor website.
threads.last_subject: Using Cursor's Agent
threads.last_body: Cursor Cursor Agent ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/overview ) can take on complex coding tasks, such as creating features or fixing bugs end-to-end. You can use it in the sidepane with Cmd/Ctrl-I. To get the most out of Agent, here are some tips: * Use â€œ@â€ in your prompt ( https://cursor.com/docs/context/symbols#definitions ) to pull in specific context, such as specific files, websites, and git branches. * If you want to jump backwards in the Agentâ€™s history, you can use checkpoints ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/chat/checkpoints ) to revert changes. * Agent can run shell commands ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/terminal ) as it works. You can also define command execution ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/terminal#command-execution-modes ) rules. * With rules ( https://cursor.com/docs/context/rules#rules ) and /commands ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/chat/commands ), you can configure system-level instructions and reusable workflows. * With cloud agents ( https://cursor.com/docs/cloud-agent ), you can spawn asynchronous agents that edit and run code in a remote environment. - Cursor Team Unsubscribe ( https://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgT_pwsBAPSntBzzp7QcAZreYtiKChCS8UINgrjOHg== )

threads.subject: Welcome to Cursor!
threads.preview: Cursor Hi there, Thanks for using Cursor! To get started, read our quickstart guide ( https://cursor
threads.summary: The Cursor Team sent a welcome email with a quickstart guide to help get started with their tool, covering features like Tab, Inline Edit, and Agent. The guide is available on their website, along with more in-depth documentation for additional questions. No meeting or follow-up is scheduled, but the team can be referenced for further support.
threads.last_subject: Welcome to Cursor!
threads.last_body: Cursor Hi there, Thanks for using Cursor! To get started, read our quickstart guide ( https://cursor.com/docs/get-started/quickstart ). It will walk through how to use Tab ( https://cursor.com/docs/tab/overview ), Inline Edit ( https://cursor.com/docs/inline-edit/overview ), and Agent ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/overview ). If you have more questions, our docs ( https://cursor.com/docs ) go into greater depth. - Cursor Team Unsubscribe ( https://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgT_pwsBAPSntBzzp7QcAZrZPHdW8idnqSH9YEf7iw== )

threads.subject: Using Cursor as a team
threads.preview: Cursor We use Cursor as a team, as do thousands of other organizations from NVIDIA to Figma. A few w
threads.summary: The Cursor Team reached out to discuss using their platform for team collaboration, similar to other organizations like NVIDIA and Figma. They highlighted integrations with Slack and Linear, as well as their Bugbot code review product and Team Rules feature. No meeting was scheduled, but the team can explore these features to improve their workflow. Next steps involve reviewing the provided links to learn more about implementation. The Cursor Team provided resources for further information.
threads.last_subject: Using Cursor as a team
threads.last_body: Cursor We use Cursor as a team, as do thousands of other organizations from NVIDIA to Figma. A few ways weâ€™ve seen teams collaborate with Cursor: * We built Slack ( https://cursor.com/docs/integrations/slack ) and Linear ( https://cursor.com/docs/integrations/linear ) integrations so you kick off agents and assign tickets by simply tagging @Cursor. * Bugbot ( https://cursor.com/bugbot ), our code review product, automatically reviews your changes with AI to help catch bugs, patch security issues, and improve code quality. * Write Team Rules ( https://cursor.com/docs/context/rules#team-rules ) to ensure consistent coding standards, practices, and workflows across your team when they use Cursor. - Cursor Team Unsubscribe ( https://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgT_pwsBANuBjhzagY4cAZq_JwK8V0XauSGMSd5ORw== )

threads.summary: The Cursor Team sent a welcome email with a quickstart guide to help us get started with their platform, covering Tab, Inline Edit, and Agent features. They also provided links to more in-depth documentation for additional questions. No meetings or next steps were discussed, just an introductory overview of their tools and resources.

It will walk through how to use Tab ( https://cursor.com/docs/tab/overview ), Inline Edit ( https://cursor.com/docs/inline-edit/overview ), and Agent ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/overview ). gmail:Cursor Team <hi@mail.cursor.com>.summary: The Cursor Team has been in touch, sharing tips and resources on how to use their Agent tool and platform for team collaboration. They've provided quickstart guides, documentation, and links to features like context symbols and code review. We can review the resources at our leisure, with no meetings scheduled, and explore integrations with tools like Slack and Linear to improve our workflow.

threads.subject: GPT-5.1 is now live in the OpenAI API
threads.preview: Start building with the newest model â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í Í â€Í
threads.summary: OpenAI has released GPT-5.1, a new model that balances intelligence and speed, with features like adaptive reasoning and extended prompt caching. The team recommends testing GPT-5.1 for coding tasks and considering switching from GPT-4.1 for general-purpose tasks. No meeting is scheduled, but you can start building with GPT-5.1 using the latest API docs.

gmail:noreply@email.openai.com.summary: OpenAI just released GPT-5.1, which promises a better balance of intelligence and speed. The team suggests we test it for coding tasks and consider switching from GPT-4.1 for general use. We can start building with GPT-5.1 using the latest API docs, no meeting is scheduled yet.

threads.preview:
You have a new recommendation for Default Directory
Designate more than one global admin
See why thi
threads.summary: Microsoft's security team has issued a recommendation for our Default Directory to designate more than one global admin, which can be reviewed and remediated in the Microsoft Entra admin center.

threads.subject: New recommendation available for Default Directory
threads.preview:
You have a new recommendation for Default Directory
Do not allow users to grant consent to unreliabl
threads.summary: Microsoft sent a recommendation to update the Default Directory settings, suggesting that users be blocked from granting consent to untrusted applications. The recommendation is accessible in the Microsoft Entra admin center, where you can also learn more about the issue and how to resolve it. No meeting is scheduled, but review and remediation are the next steps.

threads.subject: New recommendation available for Default Directory
threads.preview:
You have a new recommendation for Default Directory
Enable password hash sync if hybrid
See why this
threads.summary: Microsoft sent a recommendation to enable password hash sync for our Default Directory, applicable if we're using a hybrid setup. The suggestion is accessible in the Microsoft Entra admin center, where we can review the reasoning and take remediation steps. No meeting is scheduled, but we can review and address the recommendation at our convenience.

outlook:MSSecurity-noreply@microsoft.com.summary: Microsoft's security team has sent a few recommendations for our Default Directory, including designating multiple global admins, blocking consent to untrusted apps, and enabling password hash sync for hybrid setups. These can be reviewed and remediated in the Microsoft Entra admin center. We should take a look and address these suggestions at our convenience, no meetings are scheduled yet.

threads.subject: Third-party security incident
threads.preview: OpenAI Logo ( https://openai.com/ ) Transparency is important to us, so we want to inform you about
threads.summary: OpenAI experienced a security incident through their data analytics provider, Mixpanel, which affected limited user data, including names, email addresses, and location information. No sensitive information like passwords or API keys was compromised. OpenAI has terminated its use of Mixpanel, is conducting additional security reviews, and is notifying impacted users, advising them to be cautious of potential phishing attempts.

gmail:OpenAI <noreply@email.openai.com>.summary: There was a security incident at OpenAI through their data provider Mixpanel, affecting some user data like names and emails. Fortunately, no sensitive info was compromised. OpenAI has stopped using Mixpanel and is reviewing security, also notifying impacted users to beware of phishing attempts.

Â 
 
Â 
Â 
Key updates to Microsoft Rewards 
Â 
 
Starting in January 2026, we will be making updates to the Rewards program.
Here's what you need to know:
We're announcing 3 new participation levels with a range of benefits that allow you to earn points in new ways: Member, Silver, and Gold.
In order to accommodate these changes, the daily search point limit will update by level. They will update to Member (15), Silver (30), and Gold (60). There will be new opportunities to earn additional bonus points.
As we evaluateÂ the program, we might make more changes to further the benefits of the program. There's no action required on your part.
Visit dashboard
 
Â 
Â 
Privacy Statement
 
Microsoft Corporation,Â One Microsoft Way,Â Redmond, WA 98052

outlook:MicrosoftRewards@infoemail.micro.summary: Microsoft Rewards is getting an update in January 2026, adding new participation levels and ways to earn points. The changes include three tiers - Member, Silver, and Gold - with updated daily search point limits. No action is needed from our end, but we can expect potential future changes to enhance benefits.
